alert.note: Alert for Ford; Iroquois; Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 9:33PM CST until February 25 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON CST /1 PM EST/ THURSDAY TO 6 AM CST /7 AM EST/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation and slippery roads expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a glaze to locally up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Indiana and central and east central Illinois. * WHEN...From noon CST /1 PM EST/ Thursday to 6 AM CST /7 AM EST/ Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will likely impact the Thursday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A burst of snow is expected Thursday afternoon, possibly mixed with sleet. The precipitation will then transition to freezing rain or drizzle mixed with snow Thursday evening and night, primarily near and south of US-24.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Illinois, the latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com. In Indiana, the latest road conditions for Indiana are available by calling 1-800-261-7623 or visiting www.511in.org.
